data.title: MHI Foundation
data.text:
Amélie Brasiola, Julie Richard, and Dr. Marie-Pierre Dubé are changing cardiovascular medicine.

Find out how by reading the latest edition of our magazine.

Gilles Spinelli is planning to make a bequest to the Institute. This father of three daughters and grandfather of four grandsons knows how important this gesture is.

9 out of 10 Canadians over the age of 20 have at least one risk factor for cardiovascular disease

Julie Todd: ensuring the MHI’s medical legacy lives on

As the Montreal Heart Institute celebrates 70 years of greatly impacting the lives and health of Quebecers, it can proudly showcase its legacy thanks in large part to the work and vision of Julie Todd, Director of the Infocentre department.

Orderlies: pouring their hearts into caring for cardiovascular patients

Anick Lamontagne never thought she’d end up working in a hospital setting. But after five years in the Montreal Heart Institute’s Critical Care Unit, she can’t see herself working anywhere else.

From Barcelona to Montreal: Going beyond borders to champion the prevention and remission of diabetes

Dr. Josep Iglesies-Grau is pursuing a fellowship in preventive cardiology at the EPIC Centre. This young specialist speaks from the heart about this promising new approach in which the Institute continues to play a key role on the world stage.

The last meal

Ms. Dulude heads the Food Services and Clinical Nutrition Department at the Institute. She sheds light on one of her team’s most sensitive tasks: organizing last meals in the context of medical aid in dying.

Echocardiography: A window into what the eye can’t see

Dr. André Denault is one of the world’s leading experts in cardiac anesthesia. He tells us about the practice he implemented at the Institute that has revolutionized how experts around the globe make diagnoses.

Emergency cardiac care: In the eye of the hurricane

As Chief of Emergency Medicine at the Institute, Dr. Julie Sirois tells us what it’s really like to work in the emergency room at a specialized centre.

Heart to heart: The special relationship between nurse and patient

Clinical nurse Clarrisa Nolasco explains what makes nursing care at the Institute so unique and tells us about the human approach that has made this hospital centre a world-class institution.

Clinical perfusionists: Working behind the scenes

Hosham Ased is an ambassador of his profession. He works tirelessly to help advance the practices used in his field, and he tells us about the little-known yet critical role of clinical perfusionists.
